title: crypticj
author: crypticj
content: Hello guys!Today I was thinking about Bitcoin and where it will finally go up. And I came to the conclusion that I don't really understand what is the right thing to do with Bitcoin after it will "go to the moon".So I wanted to ask you all, what are you planing to do with bitcoin when it will go to 70k, 80k etc. Are you planing to sell it or you will keep holding it?If you will sell it, at what price are you planning to do it?

comments.author: BD Crypto
comments.body: Basically I will keep holding Bitcoin if hits new all time high. My plan is to hold Bitcoin till it's been legalized by the Government. Because we maynot be able to buy Bitcoin agin at the low price. Day by day it's popularity will gain also it's usecases. So who will sell it too early? I think selling Bitcoin is a fool decision if you don't need it badly. Keep Bitcoin holding and enjoy the Ride of Bitcoin. I have trust on Bitcoin and one-day it will be legalized and adopted massively then it will be very precious.

comments.author: danskgraes
comments.body: When Bitcoin hits 70k or 80k, I'll sell enough to pay off my student loans and take a nice vacation. After that, I'll keep holding on to it for the long haul. Who needs a Lambo when you can be debt free?

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: Personally I don't have any plan to sell my Bitcoin, but it's obviously I will sell it little by little when I see the price is really high. I will not ever sold all of my Bitcoin, I still believe the Bitcoin ATH will never end, which mean we might see Bitcoin will break new ATH for every 4 years.I will sell my coins is not because I will celebrate the new ATH and enjoy my day, but I will use it to buy Bitcoin during bear market happen.Quote from: BD Crypto on April 25, 2023, 05:01:02 AMMy plan is to hold Bitcoin till it's been legalized by the Government. Because we maynot be able to buy Bitcoin agin at the low price.What do you mean about legalized? Bitcoin is mostly accepted in many countries right now as a commodity and now there are 2 countries already accepted as a currency.

comments.author: P2PECS
comments.body: In my case I will continue to accumulate, but I will probably do some small selling in the next bull run when the price is well above $100K. Investing in bitcoin must be done with patience and holding the investment for many years to come. The longer you hold it without selling or continuing to accumulate, the more you will profit. The problem is that it is mentally very difficult not to realize any profit for many years. That's why I think it's better to take advantage of the bull markets to partially sell and enjoy the rewards, just as you can take advantage of the bear markets to reload more. Recently when the price was below $20K it was a great opportunity to reload, and at these levels it still is. And if you don't want to mess around, DCA with the same amount at regular intervals and that's it.

comments.author: Litzki1990
comments.body: Quote from: crypticj on April 25, 2023, 04:51:32 AMSo I wanted to ask you all, what are you planing to do with bitcoin when it will go to 70k, 80k etc. Are you planing to sell it or you will keep holding it?Everyone's investment style is different. Those who invest for a long time always expect something big in the market. The record for Bitcoin's highest price touch in the Bitcoin market is over $60K.  That is, until now the price of Bitcoin has never touched $70K-$80K, so everyone may expect that if the market goes to such a state, they may sell their coins. But there are many investors who are dreaming bigger. At the initial stage they are waiting for the price of Bitcoin to reach $100K and it is believed by everyone that the price of Bitcoin will reach $1 million in stages. But the amount of investment I have so far, I will wait for one hundred thousand dollars.

comments.author: Reid
comments.body: Quote from: crypticj on April 25, 2023, 04:51:32 AMHello guys!Today I was thinking about Bitcoin and where it will finally go up. And I came to the conclusion that I don't really understand what is the right thing to do with Bitcoin after it will "go to the moon".So I wanted to ask you all, what are you planing to do with bitcoin when it will go to 70k, 80k etc. Are you planing to sell it or you will keep holding it?If you will sell it, at what price are you planning to do it?Keep holding it. Because what is next might surprise us. Probably the currency that will be used anywhere you go so you won't need to cash it out for your own country's currency. As of today, that is difficult to happen as there are still many FUD that is lurking out in the internet, either social media or blogs who thinks other coins are better than it. Well, that their POV and we cannot really stop them from saying their opinion but sometimes it does hurt the demand and value of Bitcoin when they do it. Many projects went down, and soon they will realize they just need Bitcoin.

comments.author: Sayeds56
comments.body: Quote from: crypticj on April 25, 2023, 04:51:32 AMHello guys!Today I was thinking about Bitcoin and where it will finally go up. And I came to the conclusion that I don't really understand what is the right thing to do with Bitcoin after it will "go to the moon".So I wanted to ask you all, what are you planing to do with bitcoin when it will go to 70k, 80k etc. Are you planing to sell it or you will keep holding it?If you will sell it, at what price are you planning to do it?In the light of  present market situation , it is  prudent to continue accumulating Bitcoin as market price is relatively low, therefore I am taking advantage of this opportunity and buying on every significant dip to increase my holdings. My long term plan is to wait for resumption of bull cycle which is likely to occur after halving  in 2024 when Bitcoin is likely to exceed $100,000 level and that is the point where I will start selling my Bitcoins assets at that stage.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: I just want my decision to be taken based on personal conditions, not because of the market situation.Many people chase the $100k mark to sell even a fraction, but have to put off other plans that would have been better done earlier if they were to abandon that $100k.Bitcoin is freedom, don't tie your own bitcoin worse than the bank.

comments.body: Quote from: crypticj on April 25, 2023, 04:51:32 AMHello guys!Today I was thinking about Bitcoin and where it will finally go up. And I came to the conclusion that I don't really understand what is the right thing to do with Bitcoin after it will "go to the moon".So I wanted to ask you all, what are you planing to do with bitcoin when it will go to 70k, 80k etc. Are you planing to sell it or you will keep holding it?If you will sell it, at what price are you planning to do it?I might try to sell some of the Bitcoin that I hold, because one of my goals with holding Bitcoin is to be able to get profit and will hold the rest for a longer period of time. And maybe I will increase my investment, because I sure that the price of Bitcoin will not just stop at that point, it will continue to increase.

comments.author: Pandji02
comments.body: I'm planning to sell it at some point, not earlier than $100,000 for sure. And when it slides below that I'll buy some again.

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: $70k or $80k is a very conservative price, the vast majority of us believe Bitcoin will go farpast those prices.What I plan to do? I dont have any specific plans other than to HODL. To be able to use it in the future when it is absolutely needed is peace of mind. Ideally it would be nice to be in a position to be able to buy items needed directly with Bitcoin rather than having to involveexchanges and FIAT.Hopefully that will be something for the future.

comments.author: karmamiu
comments.body: If I plan to sell my bitcoin, i'd probably choose to sell it at $80,000 or more since I didn't have much hassle investing to it, besides in the first place I haven't invested much and all I have invested are from what I have earned because of working free time since I wanted my time to be more productive. It's not that I didn't want to sell but, for me it is just an option for me whether I sell it or not.

comments.author: usekevin
comments.created_time: April 25, 2023, 06:30:58 AMLast edit: April 26, 2023, 08:00:49 PM by usekevin
comments.body: The expected rise in the bitcoin price will be achieved in 2024.Because the next halves will be next year,So the next halves make the bitcoin to the next ATH.So we expected the price of bitcoin above the value of 68k in the second quarter of 2024.The moon is most common words that describe the ATH(All time high).So with your definition the price of the bitcoin will cross the value of 70-80k next year.All the bitcoin holding people just hold the bitcoin till the second quarter of 2024.If you want to earn profit,even now you can buy some bitcoin for the profit.But holding should be followed to avoid loss From the trading,don’t panic even at the bear market is second important.

And I came to the conclusion that I don't really understand what is the right thing to do with Bitcoin after it will "go to the moon".So I wanted to ask you all, what are you planing to do with bitcoin when it will go to 70k, 80k etc. Are you planing to sell it or you will keep holding it?If you will sell it, at what price are you planning to do it?Holding bitcoin until the coin hits it's ATH have been my ultimate target in the market. I'm accumulating more bitcoins during the bear season and there's hope for gigantic profits at the end. Bitcoin hitting $80k, good purpose for the project because I will triggered the sell option because I've hold on for so long for that moment. Bitcoin will not just run up to $80k without fluctuations and consolidation, he bear season will have higher hands in reducing the price of Bitcoin, but I won't let that reduce my critical thinking about the project.

comments.author: DevilSlayer
comments.body: Quote from: blackened515 on April 25, 2023, 06:52:24 AMQuote from: crypticj on April 25, 2023, 04:51:32 AMHello guys!Today I was thinking about Bitcoin and where it will finally go up. And I came to the conclusion that I don't really understand what is the right thing to do with Bitcoin after it will "go to the moon".So I wanted to ask you all, what are you planing to do with bitcoin when it will go to 70k, 80k etc. Are you planing to sell it or you will keep holding it?If you will sell it, at what price are you planning to do it?Holding bitcoin until the coin hits it's ATH have been my ultimate target in the market. I'm accumulating more bitcoins during the bear season and there's hope for gigantic profits at the end. Bitcoin hitting $80k, good purpose for the project because I will triggered the sell option because I've hold on for so long for that moment. Bitcoin will not just run up to $80k without fluctuations and consolidation, he bear season will have higher hands in reducing the price of Bitcoin, but I won't let that reduce my critical thinking about the project.As for me, I sold most of my bitcoins because there will be a huge dump that will happen anytime soon. The price already resisted around $31,000 and the possibility of making a swing low is now very high. My plan is to get more positions again when the price of the bitcoin reach the major support level again. The reason why I sold my bitcoin is just because I followed my plan, my bias got invalidated and it is the reason why I reacted and sold most of it. Did I do the right thing? As for me yes as long as I followed my plan.My next plan is to wait and get a lot of positions in the cheaper price, in that way I can maximize my profit when the price of the bitcoin beat it s current ATH. As for the short term, I'm bearish but for the long term; I'm still bullish and I hope that it will only take some weeks to months before we see higher highs and higher lows again.

comments.author: Forever101
comments.body: Holding it when the price rises Is not a wise decision  as there may be a retrace of the price movement. The best option is to sell in bit in every ATM high. This is what I mean, you can divide your crypto into 4 parts and sell in every all time high. You can sell first 25% of your bitcoins when the price hit 35k , asecond  25% when it hits 45k, third 25% when it hits 60k and the 4th 25% when it hits 70k- to 80k. After selling, you can keep some of the money to buy when it hits it's all time low. And most of the money can be diversify into investing on other things, if you have enough money, you can become an employer of labour by creating job. It all depends on individuals. In conclusion, whatever you will do with your profit, make sure the profit generate revenue for you.

comments.author: $crypto$
comments.body: Quote from: crypticj on April 25, 2023, 04:51:32 AMSo I wanted to ask you all, what are you planing to do with bitcoin when it will go to 70k, 80k etc. Are you planing to sell it or you will keep holding it?If you will sell it, at what price are you planning to do it?Every bitcoin holder always has their own plan with a target price for bitcoin which will be sold later, I myself don't know how strong it is to hold bitcoin even though the bitcoin price has reached the level of $70k-$100k but I believe the stronger you hold it, the profit will be even bigger, see how the bitcoin cycle happens, of course it will multiply the value of your bitcoin at its selling price.If there is an urgent desire or need, I will sell it, but I feel that I have enough at a certain price, so I will release bitcoin at that price, but I am sure that many plans from investors are their wish to be able to sell at $100K.
